DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this prospective, randomized study was to compare the clinical and radiographic results and the prevalence of osteolysis of the cementless total hip arthroplasty with an alumina-on-alumina bearings one side and alumina-on-highly cross-linked polyethylene bearings on the other side in the young and active patients.
DOC.brief_title: Comparison of Ceramic-on-Ceramic and Ceramic-on-Highly-Cross-Linked Polyethylene Bearings
DOC.criteria: Primary hip osteoarthritis Secondary hip osteoarthritis Avascular necrosis of femoral head Previous surgical history of hip
DOC.keyword: ceramic on highly cross linked polyethylene
